channel.title: Port Technology International
channel.description: Latest news in port and maritime technology

item.title: New AI-Powered Crane System Deployed at Rotterdam Port
item.description: Rotterdam port has unveiled its latest AI-powered crane system designed to improve container handling efficiency by 40%. The system uses computer vision and machine learning algorithms to optimize container placement and reduce turnaround times.

item.title: Smart Port Initiative Launches in Singapore
item.description: Singapore's Maritime and Port Authority has announced a $500 million investment in smart port technologies, including IoT sensors, autonomous vehicles, and blockchain-based supply chain tracking. The initiative aims to position Singapore as the global leader in maritime innovation.

item.title: Green Hydrogen Fuel Cells for Maritime Vessels
item.description: A consortium of European shipping companies has successfully tested green hydrogen fuel cells on a cargo vessel, marking a significant milestone in the industry's push toward zero-emission shipping. The technology could reduce maritime emissions by up to 90%.
